title: US press freedom under scrutiny after arrest of two journalists during Minneapolis protests
subhed: The arrests of Don Lemon, on Thursday evening in Los Angeles, who was released the following day, and reporter Georgia Fort marked another milestone in the American government's political use of the justice system.

title: US envoy reports 'constructive' Ukraine talks with Russia
French IT giant Capgemini to sell US subsidiary after row over ICE links
Over 300 people thought missing in Mediterranean as shipwrecks continue
subhed: In mid-January, eight vessels that had departed Tunisia were reported in distress. As many as 380 people were on board these boats, according to one radio station. All are now considered missing.

title: Israel to end Doctors Without Borders work in Gaza
subhed: Israel said Sunday it would end the work of Doctors Without Borders in Gaza after it failed to provide a list of its Palestinian staff.

title: Syria's government reaches agreement with Kurds of Rojava
subhed: A ceasefire has been established after three weeks of fighting. The Kurds have secured major gains in local autonomy and national rights, while the Syrian president claims to have restored national unity.
byline: By Hélène Sallon (Damascus, Syria, special correspondent)

title: In Italy, the 'forest family' becomes a blessing for the far right
subhed: Many have rallied behind a couple living in seclusion in a forest, whose children were taken into care by the courts. Matteo Salvini's Lega party has unleashed harsh criticism against the judges.

title: General Philippe Morillon, former UN commander during the Bosnian War, dies at 90
Who's running in the Paris mayoral election?
byline: By Manon Romain and Hélène Bekmezian

title: Gaza civil defense says 32 killed in Israeli strikes
An AI clone and a publicly traded company: The irresistible rise of TikToker Khaby Lame
France tightens infant formula rules after toxin scare
Appeals trial for murder of teacher Samuel Paty focuses on defendants' personal lives
Catherine O'Hara, iconic comedy figure, dies age 71
Venezuela's interim president announces mass amnesty law
US Senate passes deal expected to shorten shutdown
Social media ban for under-15s: Why everyone in France will soon have to verify their age
byline: By Damien Leloup and Florian Reynaud

title: Switzerland's ill-prepared army faces new global disorder
US Justice Department releases over 3 million more pages of Epstein files
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Yuri Dmitriev, the Russian historian imprisoned for denouncing Kremlin attempts to rewrite history
subhed: Detained in a penal colony in Mordovia, the 70-year-old historian, who specializes in the Stalin regime's crimes, is one of Russia's oldest political prisoners. His crime? Refusing to accept historical falsifications that the Kremlin aims to impose on public opinion.

title: Blocking the Russian army: Ukraine's impossible mission
subhed: With limited technical and human resources, soldiers and engineers in these units, increasingly exposed to drone fire, are trying to contain the Russian army, which continues to make slow but steady advances.

title: 'Facing Trump, Europe, Canada and Latin America have to navigate between misalignment, non-alignment and avoidance'
subhed: The sweeping powers that the US president has granted himself through his Board of Peace serve only to discourage even the best intentions, observes Le Monde's columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Environment: Europe's temptation to unravel hard-won progress, ignoring scientific truth
Zaki Laïdi, political scientist: 'In 2025, building spheres of influence is infinitely more difficult than during the Cold War'
Thomas Piketty: 'European countries have achieved unprecedented levels of prosperity and social well-being'
